result.execSummary:
The defendant Vandell M Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Vandell M Anderson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Vandell M Anderson was found guilty of Possess Short-barreled Shotgun/Rifle, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.28(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program. 
++  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
++  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.   Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Jason Sanders.  Clerk/S. Garcia.  On state's motion counts 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10 are dismissed.  The defendant pleads guilty to count 5; court finds the defendant guilty of count 5.  The court orders a pre-sentence investigation.  Sentencing set for 11/22/16 @ 2:00.  Bond continued.
Appearances:  ADA Delgado; Atty Sanders w/DE (I/C).  Atty Sanders enters speedy trial demand.  FPT set for 9/30/16 at 10:00.  JT set for 10/17/16 at 8:30.

Per Judge Bastianelli, Atty Sanders' request for an adjournment of the status conf. on 8/4/16 at 9:00 is granted; rescheduled for 8/10/16 at 11:00.  Court date confirmed with Atty Sanders.  D.A. to prepare writ.  D.A. notified by email.

rec'd from Atty Sanders requesting the STC on 8/4/16 at 9:00 be rescheduled.
